intro: Pilosella villarsii, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are hairy and spoon-shaped, and the flowers are white with a yellow center. Pilosella villarsii is often found in mountainous areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
